Reviews.Content: Columbia City Bakery has some of the best bread/baguette in Seattle.  There's a reason most of the restaurants around have Columbia City Bakery as its bread supplier.  It's really freaking good.I've only had the bread here, so I can't vouch for anything...but who cares about anything else when you can get bread this amazing?!?!  It's so crusty on the outside and so soft on the inside...it's the best of all worlds.It's a beautiful thing.  If you ever need to give me a present and don't know what to get me, just bring me a loaf of the baguette from here and you will have made me the happiest girl.  It's really that good!

Reviews.Author: Sin-Yaw W.
Reviews.Content: We don't drive far for cakes, but kid was in the search for a hazelnut cake and this place came out.  It is about 15 minutes from Seattle downtown and on we went for an adventure.The long line of Friday breakfast time is encouraging and the place is clearly a local favorite with many yummy looking offerings.  Bread, cake, tarts, cookies, etc.  Everything was tempting.  In addition to the hazelnut cake, we bought scones and they were very good.  I like my scone crunchy and flaky.  Theirs are soft and yielding like bread, but delicious nevertheless.The hazelnut cake took some serious evaluation over the next several days.  Kid and I agreed that it is delicious and nicely made.  I like my cake fluffier but kid convinced me that is just not how hazelnut cakes are. It is a dense cake, very chocolate and nutty, and just the right sweetness.  It goes perfectly with a good cup of coffee.

Reviews.Author: Nana I.
Reviews.Content: I've been told many times that this bakery has the best breads in the area. I only got to try the bread in sandwich form when I stopped by but I'm still fairly convinced that the statement above is true. A little disappointed that all their sandwiches are pre-made and refrigerated but the flavor of both bread and filling (tuna) was still intact & delicious. We (my mom aka bakery-partner-in-crime) also had a danish that was overflowing with blueberries which I just cannot get enough of! It was perfectly golden brown, brushed with a sweet glaze & every bite was filled with juicy blueberry goodness. Although a bit out of the way, I'm definitely willing to go back just to buy a loaf of bread &/or that danish!

Reviews.Author: Becky G.
Reviews.Content: My friend Vienna was telling me how good this bakery is so I had to stop in to grab a quick lunch.I got a Tomato Jam sandwich with goat cheese and arugula, YUM.I never see tomato jam and I'm always craving it.(under $6!)My boyfriend got a ham and cheese croissant, it was yummy too.We tried their dill bagel chips, I didn't see them to buy but they were yummy too.They just put out a loaf of whiskey cake and Jack was very tempted to get some.I would highly recommend this place if you want something yummy.Could have been a little more friendly.

Reviews.Author: Hana P.
Reviews.Content: As soon as you walk into this bakery, the aroma of sweet and savory breads and pastries begin to fill your nose. I recommend their Kitchen Sink cookies, a yummy cookie concoction consisting of oats, cranberries, and various other awesome ingredients. I also love their pretzel dog, ham & cheese croissant and cakes!The staff can be a little snooty, but the delicious bakery items I get make up for it. Love the feel of the place, very natural and basic! I recommend going here on the weekdays after 2p, because weekends are way too crowded for my liking.

Reviews.Author: Robert V.
Reviews.Content: So, this is a tough place to review.  The baked goods are yummy, but the prices are much higher than the food/atmosphere merits.  The staff is always friendly, but never fast.I'm so torn because I want the CCB to be the epitome of cute neighborhood shop, and visibly it is, but it has the overall feel of a yuppie establishment.  Also, I find that there is very little that I can have from here as everything contains some sort of nut or fruit that will make me swell up and die.  I would love to see a more diverse selection.Sorry if I'm harsh, but I really wanted something different from the Columbia City Bakery.

Reviews.Author: Katherine T.
Reviews.Content: I go here almost every day. OMG good sandwiches (TURKEY!!!!!). I wake up late just so I can eat lunch and go here. Also the tarts, the frangipane (I'm sure that got misspelled almost as badly as I pronounce it) is amazing. Seriously, like 5 times in the last week. And I live in North Seattle.

Reviews.Author: Dennis S.
Reviews.Content: A great bakery that's much needed in Columbia City. This place is hopping, especially on Saturday and Sunday mornings. Entire families will go here to sit and enjoy beverages and baked goods.I tend to always order their pear danish but everything here seems to be stellar from what I've tasted.The service here is good. Of course, when it's busy the customer service is compromised but what can you do but be patient because you need what they have LOL.I'll order a coffee or even a mocha when I go here. It's good and strong enough. The price for some of the items at this price is a little high, but that's to be expected from a popular place that located right in the heart of vibrant and revitalized Columbia City.

Reviews.Author: Rich S.
Reviews.Content: Every now and then, as I'm working in my office, my mind wanders back to the delicious bostok pastry served at Columbia City Bakery. Thick brioche bread, covered with a layer of sliced almonds, powdered sugar with a hint of citrus and other flavors.Wander in (best in the off hours, when you might find parking outside or a table inside - they're not that big), order a pastry and coffee, read the paper or get on-line for a bit, and before you leave, buy a baguette for home.  This bakery is wonderful, the bread is for real, and the atmosphere isn't just neighborly, it epitomizes much of what I like about Columbia City.

Reviews.Author: Ken Y.
Reviews.Content: Seriously delicious baked goods here, and the staff is always friendly. It's hard *not* to stop by when I'm in the neighborhood. My faves here are...the tomato jam sandwich...only for folks who are into chewy bread with a generous coating of crunchy, flavorful seeds (I'm vegetarian, so I haven't tried their meaty sandwiches.)the focaccia, whose herby tomato sauce is robust and has a bit of kick (maybe some chili in there?)...and they might heat it up for you, if you're real nice-likethe tahini cookies...little morsels of sesame seed-coated heaventhe dilly chips...thinly sliced (pretzel?) bread discs toasted to crispy perfectionthe walnut crostini...generously brushed with olive oil and also toasted to a crisp--goes great with a cold beerstout cake with espresso icing...speaks for itself, I think. (..and if you're into cardamom, look for the cardamom coffee cake.)and for the slightly more adventurous, the Sicilian prune cookies, which are more like delicate bars...a prune filling with nuts and hints of orange (maybe some zest?) between two, light layers of cake/cookie and a flaky topOf course, there's lots more to try. Oh, just a note that the savory scones can have bits of bacon/ham in them. The health nut scone (slightly sweet) tastes better than it sounds or looks (with all those flax seeds and whatnot), but I do find it a bit on the dry and crumbly side. I suppose loading it up with butter and white cake flour would be--how you say--less healthy. OK, time for me to get some tahini cookies...

Reviews.Author: Miki C.
Reviews.Content: I love this bakery. I agree with another reviewer, that I wish there was more diversity in the selection. I have nut allergies and gluten-sensitivity. But their baked goods are so darn good, that I can't stay away. I love the bran muffin, croissants (although not the best in the city), and the pre-made lunch sandwiches.The staff is always friendly to me when I go in every week. It is a great neighborhood bakery, and beats even any bakery in Capitol Hill. The bakers here are serious about their craft and it shows in their wonderful baked goods.

Reviews.Author: Andrea K.
Reviews.Content: This is probably a superfluous review because there are so many rave ones, but I'm feeling Yelp-y today so here. goes:Went here with my partner in pastry exploring crime on a Sunday morning. Was worried we'd have to wait in line forever. Luckily, the line wasn't bad at all and they were moving quickly. In fact, I'm pretty glad there was a line because otherwise I would not have had adequate time to figure out what to get. So many options, seriously. So many! Ended up getting the mini-rhubarb tart, a pain au chocolat, and an ice coffee. All delicious..so delectably flaky! I managed to save the tart for when I got home (talk about will power, huh?) and when I microwaved it, it was so warm and delightful (fear not, I made sure to eat a good chunk of the crust before doing so, so the crust didn't get mushy). People were super friendly (case in point: I spilled my coffee .2 seconds after receiving it, they made me a new one ASAP and didn't give me dirty looks).Definitely would go back...there are about 50 more things I want to try there (profiteroles, anyone?). At about 10:45-11 on a Sunday they were running out of a few flavors of scones and muffins, so I may have to bust my ass up a little earlier the next Sunday I check it out.

Reviews.Author: Eric P.
Reviews.Content: All right so we got over here because of the great reviews Empire Espresso received - they had nothing to eat so we wandered around the corner and tripped onto Columbia City Bakery - they saved our day!!Such a great, hip, quaint spot that was fun bustling, and quintessential Seattle "neighborhood" joint.  Staff was super friendly and patient even with the line out the door.  Had some quiche, ham and Gruyere croissant, and pretzel knot - all fabulous.  Can't speak to everything yet, but will give as much as we can a shot in the future.Brilliant little place and YES we will be back again very soon!

Reviews.Author: Trang H.
Reviews.Content: There's not much more to be said for this bustling bakery that already hasn't been said.  The pastries and breads are delicious and the service is friendly.  Some things to note:-Parking can be tough, especially on the very popular weekends.-They charge $2.50 to write a message on a cake, however, their chocolate cake, which I ordered for a friend's birthday, was the best I've ever had.  -It's not cheap, but the price reflects the quality and the quality is outstanding.-On a whim, I bought one of the 6'' coconut cakes on display and while overall the it was delicious, the cake portion was slightly dry.  I'm wondering if it was a day old?   However, it was still good, and polished off quickly.  Lesson learned:  if you can, pre-order your cake so they can make it fresh.Other than that, sit back, relax with a good cup of coffee, yummy pastry and enjoy the people watching or catch up on some reading at this friendly neighborhood spot.  Just don't do this on Saturday or Sunday mornings, when the place is packed and folks are on the lookout for a table!

Reviews.Author: Ann W.
Reviews.Content: I give my gluten free diet a break when I see Columbia City Bakery's chewy and fresh pretzels!! It is so worth the pain and bloating. But on days when I can't stand the pain, I will go for one of their gluten free choices: sour cherry bar or almond anise cookie. They also have a few vegan options--the ginger cookie and those addictive pretzels. I took one star off my previous review since I tried their coffee, which was not very good. I had a hazelnut latte and I did not taste the hazelnut; it was actually quite bitter and tasted a little burnt. Oh well, it won't stop me from being a pretzel monster!

Reviews.Author: Lisa M.
Reviews.Content: Love Love Love this place. Holds a special spot in my heart as the only place I've discovered in the US that really makes baked goods comparable to those found in france. Their coffee is also good

Reviews.Author: Steven H.
Reviews.Content: Honestly, I think this place may be going downhill. I have been here many times, and it used to be an amazing place. Very hip, and accepting. I visited recently, and the customer service was..not rude, but somehow irritable, and cold. The coffee was mediocre, but the pastries are good. What really turned me off was the customer service, if the workers are in the customer service industry, then they should be working for the customer. I will definitely give them another chance, but for now? a downer cafe if I ever saw one.Edit:I went back here yesterday, and the customer service was much friendlier, I must have caught the current staff on an off-day. The coffee was much better, and I enjoyed my visit. Still pricey, that hasn't changed in the past week ;) Either way, keep it up!

Reviews.Author: Kelly A.
Reviews.Content: You will LOVE Columbia City Bakery's food but when things get busy, re-think your choice and try some other place. I've seen people wait up to 30 minutes (!) for an espresso drink and the help seems to get stressed out a when business is hectic. No one ever seems to have the time to explain their many, many offerings and the people who work the register often seem clueless. That said, we are ADDICTED to the Mortadella sandwich and the Loki Roll (an amazingly chewy, crunchy salmon sandwich). But when we come here, it is definitely for a QUICK visit so we can get out of the chaos ASAP. This is unfortunate because I like to linger and have a dessert (or two) and maybe a coffee. It may be delicious but not worth the trouble and agitation.

Reviews.Author: Josh C.
Reviews.Content: This place is the daily bright-spot in my new neighborhood.  The baked goods are off the charts....The coffee is excellent and the staff is better.I am one who needs my savory morning breakfast (on the go) to function, and they do it well.  If that was a good thing, then the sweet pastries are better.I can't speak enough praises about them!

Reviews.Author: Brent C.
Reviews.Content: Home of the Brickhard Baguette! My girlfriend and I bought a baguette here last Sunday. We had some of it that night with dinner. By the end of dinner both our jaws were hurting from trying to chew on this thing. I had some more today (3 days later) and I could not bite through it.1 star for a terrible product+ 1 for good customer service and no line at the register.

Reviews.Author: Joe P.
Reviews.Content: I used to go every every weekend, but decided against going any longer because of one thing: rude customer service.Don't get me wrong, the pasties are really good. I really like their bostoks, and would go back every day if I didn't think the people weren't so obnoxiously snobby and had an air of "a-hole-ness" about them.

Reviews.Author: Ushuaia F.
Reviews.Content: This is a cute place, the pastries are cute too; If you are on a diet, the half size croissant might be right for you. But come to think of it, since they butter up their prices, your may end up with an indigestion. The good news is, they have very few choices of cookies, pastries or bread; it took me less than one minute to realize that I was in the wrong place. Two stars for trying to revive this neighborhood.

Reviews.Author: Mike V.
Reviews.Content: amazing coffee and baked goods!!! need i say more?

Reviews.Author: Kimberley D.
Reviews.Content: i went here on the recommendation of someone online as part of a search for the perfect pastry & the perfect coffee. OMG SO GOOD. totally worth the drive down there, even if you live nowhere nearby. i tried the cinnamon buns which were like a cinnamon bun without frosting squished into a roll... except also light and fluffy like a croissant. (the actual croissants were sold out, unfortunately.) i decided to try the bear claw on the advice of the previous poster. i usually don't like them... i tend to find them too sickly sweet. this was an exception: the perfect balance of sweet and sourdough-y. the espresso eclair tasted quite fine. the homemade granola and yogurt also rocked. and they made a delicious latte to boot. very recommended.

Reviews.Author: Anju N.
Reviews.Content: Delicious chocolate chip cookies. Also had an iced latte on a hot summer Seattle day that hit the spot!  The cupcakes and cakes look scrumptious though I didn't try them. Next visit for sure!

Reviews.Author: Libby C.
Reviews.Content: The food, the coffee, the atmosphere, the staff = grade A.  All the other reviewers are correct.  What I want to cheer them on for is their community work.  Every year I see them participate in Lifelong AIDS Alliance Dining Out For Life.  It's also standard to go in and see "Marriage Equality: cookies or some such thing.  I freaking love it.

Reviews.Author: Martine W.
Reviews.Content: OK, so I have put off writing this review due to a conflict of interest.  But since people are doubting the thoroughness of research for the Great Croissant Tour of Seattle, here it is.  My friend Cassie is a baker here which makes me already love this place.  Even if I didn't know one of the bakers and respect her work enormously, the pastries here speak for themselves.  I have to say I think the bread and cake I had here was better than the croissants, but the almond croissant I had was a little piece of heaven so that tells you how good the bread is.  I also think the cafe is a cute little place to hang out.  I only wish it were closer to home!

Reviews.Author: T A.
Reviews.Content: highlights:the pistachio snail is what happens when french pastry chefs fall in love with middle eastern sweets. the pain au chocolate is dreamy. the breads are phenomenal. the frenchified bear claw is a masterpiece.obviously, i avoid this place for health reasons.

Reviews.Author: amy c.
Reviews.Content: Good coffee, amazing pastries. I wish they had a few more gluten-free options, but the few they have are perfect for my son. I'd recommend the Bostak for a sweet treat... yum. This is a great place to get a hostess gift too. Packages of cookies, amazing bread, etc...

Reviews.Author: Sheila Y.
Reviews.Content: I love me the pretzel dog rolls at Columbia City Bakery.  I have been known to order four or five...bag em up...throw em in the freezer and pull them out for just out of the oven goodness.  I have also ordered their German-style Vollkorn bread (full of nuts and oats) and all their little tarts and pastries are divine.  This is a great place to stop after you hit up the Wednesday afternoon farmer's market and hey while you are at it you might as well head down the way to Tutta Bella for a pizza to share with whoever your partner in crime may be at the moment.  This was my Columbia City circuit once a week last summer and boy do I miss it!

Reviews.Author: Jeff L.
Reviews.Content: I can tell you why I'm in a recession.  All my money is going to this place! This place sells crack with yeast wrapped around it.

Reviews.Author: Rassamee H.
Reviews.Content: Delicious, somewhat pricey, but worth the splurge. They serve Caffe Vita coffee, which I enjoy, and the baristas are always really friendly. I used to know people by name, but there's been a bit of a turnover:( I am always torn between the chocolate crossiants and the danishes. Their savory crossiants are also yummy. And being in grad school, there have been times when I have been able to study there. Of course, I stuck out like a sore thumb with all the babies and families and cool people. That won't stop me though:)

Reviews.Author: freckles a.
Reviews.Content: Good artisan bread and sandwiches for lunch! The sweet pastries are very tasty too!I've tried the sandwiches at B.Nouveau and they are okay but the bread there doesnt really stand up to C.City Bakery's.I've also tried Grand Central Bakery too...and C.City Bakery wins over them too.

Reviews.Author: Timmmaahh W.
Reviews.Content: All I can say is Ham & Gruyere croissant.  Damn that is tasty.  The place is hopping every time I go and they have such delicious treats.  My favorite neighborhood bakery for sure.

Reviews.Author: B S.
Reviews.Content: I have not found a bread or bread product I did not LOVE here. Must haves: Perfectly delicious baguettes, pistachio pinwheel, and cookies. I only wish it could be closer to my home. Oh well, I will just visit as often as I can.

Reviews.Author: Kozby E.
Reviews.Content: Cozy lobby area, open kitchen and variety of delicious sandwiches. In the area, that's  one of my favorite spots. The staff is very friendly and lattes comes with artistic figures on the foam:) Parking might be a challenge but this is just the area like that. There must be more parking in the back of the block. I am going back:)

Reviews.Author: Jennifer S.
Reviews.Content: The bread here is the best! I am so happy to have this bakery in my neighborhood, however I did talk to a woman that came from West Seattle to buy her bread!

Reviews.Author: Aaron H.
Reviews.Content: Yes, the service is off on some days....and yes, the debit charge of .50 is kinda cheap (but I get the business side of it).  Bieberle, quiches, cinnamon twists, hamburger buns, sourdough loafs, and pan au chocolats are all great though.  To boot this is my neighborhood so i want to keep supporting the local business even with its short comings.  When you go in just have cash, be prepared for a little attitude, and enjoy your pastries.

Reviews.Author: Sara N.
Reviews.Content: Well, I feel badly that I am the first to write a non 5 star review of this place. I really want to give it 5 stars, and I really will go back and try it again. I think that I was expecting it to be out of this world, and since it took us a while to get there..first, we locked our keys in the house, and we had to break in to retrieve them..then, we hit traffic on I-5 (we live in Ravenna), then, there was a huge detour and all this construction on Ranier Ave...and, so when we finally arrived, an hour later, I was thinking, DAMN, this better be excellent. I was picturing a place where we would feel like lingering, cozy and warm...and, this place while smelling sweet of pastry and yeasty goodness, was a little bare bones in the atmosphere respect. That is ok, though..that said, the pastries looked delicious and I had a hard time deciding and went with an apple swirly looking croissant-like pastry. While the texture was perfect, that balance between flaky, crisp and chewy, the flavor lacked. I liked that it wasnt super sweet, but i think at least the added sugar and maybe a touch of cinnamon would have brought some more flavor to the dud apples inside. Funny, I am not usually an apple pastry person, so I think that I should have gone with my ultimate, pain au chocolate..but, the look of the apple pastry drew me in, and I was a little disappointed. Again, I hate to break the 5 star roll. I love to see small bakeries succeed, and I love that this place is doing well, so I will be back. I will say that I also bought the Volkhorn Bread, which has transported me back to Swiss/Germany..it is good.

Reviews.Author: Something Like a Phenomenon S.
Reviews.Content: 4 stars for the cardamom coffee cake.  Minus a star for the lackadaisical service I received from the counterperson.  Neither a "can I help you?" or a "thank you" during the entire interaction which--thanks to her Dark Lady of the Sith attitude--was brief.  The other counterpeople seemed nice, but I got stuck with Asajj Ventress.  Go figure.

Reviews.Author: Ken L.
Reviews.Content: Excellent bakery.  The baguettes, bread, sandwich rolls, and pastries are fresh and tasty.  I usually grab a few sandwich rolls and the beloved banana danish, the best dessert ever made!  I am so sad today because I dropped by in the afternoon and they were OUT of danishes!!  :(  Mental note to self: make sure you get there early for danish you dodo!

Reviews.Author: Rachel G.
Reviews.Content: Grabbed a few treats here the other day for a little tea party I was having. The place is adorable and I can see myself hanging out there getting some work done but the pastries I got were just OK. The mini-strawberry rhubarb pie was the best thing I had next to some lemon cheesecake. I wasn't a fan of the square cupcakes with way too much frosting. I could take it or leave it.

Reviews.Author: Touch M.
Reviews.Content: i really want to love columbia city bakery. bright and airy. great aromas of baking yummystuffs. fresh flowers adorning tables. what's not to love? and coffee's good. first time i went there i got a slice of the cheesecake, chocolate pudding, and fig danish. all decent. my gripe, though. is with the service. yes, we're served swiftly, but the couple of strange encounters i've had with the staff manning the counters have left a bad taste in my mouth - enough for me to resist going back even though i pass by fairly often. two or three times now i've attempted to  order a macchiato. each time i've been "corrected" and asked whether i really meant a latte instead. hmmmm.. i can't help but perceive a bit of condescension there. i'm not a big coffee connoisseur - but living in seattle you do pick up a few things. that on top of the sometimes indifferent demeanor of some of the staff leaves me feeling "meh." not so impressed. i'd probably do a four star, but the above incident has repeated itself so i'm kind of weary. anyway, i did also order a birthday cake from here and had great service over the phone. although the cake (a lemon buttermilk cake with cheesecake frosting) turned out kind of dry and i found the flavors to be just okay.  i'm not giving up on this place yet though. i still very much like the atmosphere and lighting and appreciate what they have to offer. and i've yet to try some of the savory items and sandwiches. so there are things that can change my mind. and i'd still recommend that you try it out for yourself. but i'll be ordering my coffee from around the corner instead from now on. ;)

Reviews.Author: Joel L.
Reviews.Content: Really good baked goods.  I pick up an assortment of pastries from here when I'm trying to impress people.  Tasty and unique.

Reviews.Author: Fred N.
Reviews.Content: I love this place.  Great atmosphere, friendly staff, and delicious baked goods.  Also, since it's in Columbia City, the city provides free wifi - so you can drink your latte and eat your YUMMY croissant (with their jelly, which is key) and work on your computer... assuming you're not distracted looking at the cool art on their walls.

Reviews.Author: Mei-I F.
Reviews.Content: I used to work at a restaurant that served their house bread, the crusty white loaf, and I seriously could not get enough of it!  Now that I don't work there anymore, my pants feel loser.  I know their secret.  They put crack in there.  It is the best artisan loaf ever.  Their baguette is also among the best I have ever had.  There's crack in there too.  The restaurant would also order other varieties of bread (broiche, potato, etc.) and they were all carb heaven!!  So I have never actually been to the bakery itself, but I can definitely get a taste what is to come once I step foot in there.

Reviews.Author: Tonya W.
Reviews.Content: OK, so I just go here to buy their Goat / Sheeps milk cheese . But the rest of the stuff looks yummy too. The cheese? AWESOME!

Reviews.Author: MiChin L.
Reviews.Content: This place would be perfect if the hordes of screaming kids and their overly-lenient parents ("Trevor, I already asked you nicely to stop licking people you don't know!") would go away.  That small tidbit aside--the ham and guyere croissants will call to you in your dreams. Although your butt may soon be overpopulated with cellulite because of that lovely buttery goodness, you only live once and you will regret not enjoying one of these at least once a week.

Reviews.Author: Erin K.
Reviews.Content: After a delectable breakfast across the street at Geraldine's, stopped in for cookies, muffins and brownies.  All of which, according to friends who quickly inhaled them down, were delicious and remarkable in every way.  No line, beautiful breads, fudgy brownies.  Go there.

Reviews.Author: Ariana G.
Reviews.Content: I don't find there selection of baked goods that amazing, a lot of stuff is dry and just sugar and flour...where is the fruit and more interesting baked goods? However, their bread is great and their pretzels even better!

Reviews.Author: Sara H.
Reviews.Content: I live down the street, jealous?

Reviews.Author: Lori D.
Reviews.Content: My newest favorite is the lemon ginger scone. This scone is the best I've ever had. Perfect texture - not the too doughy or the too hard that have led me to toss a scone after the first two bites. No, this scone is flavored with just the right combination of lemon and candied ginger bits to make me want to keep eating a second and third immediately. Amy, my favorite barista, turned me on to these and the only thing wrong is that sometimes they aren't quite out of the oven when I arrive early in the morning!Thanks, CCB!

Reviews.Author: Sasha C.
Reviews.Content: I live in the neighborhood and it makes me so happy to have such a community-minded business in our area.  The pastries are DELICIOUS!  I've had cookies, cupcakes, and a morning muffin there, all of them were fantatsic.  They actually have a huge variety of baked goods so I'm looking forward to trying a bunch more...it'll take me a while to get through all those options!  They deliver service with a smile, everybody I've encountered working behind the counter is helpful, patient and friendly.  But the thing that seals the deal for me is the fact that they support many worthy social justice causes.  It makes their sweets taste even sweeter.  Thank you Columbia City Bakery!

Reviews.Author: wade m.
Reviews.Content: Good pastries and tea, and a relaxed atmosphere. The Sweet and I sat for an afternoon on their sidewalk. The fruit tart was very good, with more custard than most. The pretzel would have used a bit more salt. They serve Honest Teas, which are always good! Lots of families walked by, and inevitably a pre-verbal toddler would waddle up and point at the bakery, with pleading eyes toward its parents. Clearly this is a well-loved neighborhood bakery, with a relaxed atmosphere and plenty of friendly people.

Reviews.Author: dave m.
Reviews.Content: This place provides a much needed service in this neighborhood: delicious breads and pastries prepared daily.   I've found good bakeries are had to come across in some other nearby neighborhoods, evidenced in the patrons who come from all around to visit the bakery.  Yes, they are a bit expensive, but you pay for the quality of the food, neighborhood atmosphere and quaintness they bring to Columbia City.   I'm willing to pay a bit more than at the supermarket to keep this place thriving and fresh bread readily available.   I love the ham and  gruyere croissant, the tuna fish sandwiches and the p&b cookies.  I

Reviews.Author: Erin W.
Reviews.Content: just picked up some bread for thanksgiving! i don't know if i can save it until tomorrow... it smells so good! i am super excited about the yam rolls, yum. i also got a mocha, it was amazing! nice latte art, and they even cleaned my gross old mason jar that i wanted my drink in (!) with sweet smiles. goodness i love this place. my son ate a shortbread cookie, it took him only seconds. :)the cakes and pies looked pretty amazing... wish i would have bought one!the service was above average, made my day.

Reviews.Author: Chris B.
Reviews.Content: Last Thanksgiving they even had pies available the day before - even if you didn't order one! Apple pie is awesome. The reusable pie tin is also great if you made your own pies. But don't start making your own because then you might stop going to the bakery. Great cookies, too.

Reviews.Author: Madeline W.
Reviews.Content: The employees here are so friendly and give great advice on what to get.  Everything I got here was delicious and the bread (especially the apricot and walnut bread) is amazing.  Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Author: Jacquie P.
Reviews.Content: Everything we tried here was wonderful. I wholeheartedly recommend the bostok! It has a fun, bustling atmosphere and friendly staff. Prices were comparable to other indy bakeries in the area and it seems to get just as busy. I stopped in at 7:30am on a Saturday and all the little tables were already occupied but there was plenty of street parking outside so I have a feeling it fills up with the local regulars pretty quickly. Welp, no need to go into too much detail considering the millions of other great reviews, so I'll just say big thumbs up!

Reviews.Author: Melissa J.
Reviews.Content: Columbia City Bakery has good coffee and yummy sweet & savory baked goods.  I'm a fan of their breads, but the cake is where it's at.  Get one of these for the next office party, slice thin (rich stuff!),  pick up a bottle of cheap bubbly, & you'll be the Employee of the Year.

Reviews.Author: See Y.
Reviews.Content: Service leaves something to be desired. This seems to be the common theme with this bakery.  The only reason I buy overpriced bread here is to support a small business.  I don't even like bread, but was willing to support the business until tonight.  I walked in, and asked for a bread advertised as $2.50.  She charged me $3.  Perhaps I should have said something, but with a selection so small, this mistake should not have occurred.  Don't put up one price then charge me something else.  I think she was just being a jerk to me, because I asked whether they could slice my bread and she said they couldn't.  Oh, well.  That's the answer, fine, but don't be a jerk to me just because.  I can easily take my business elsewhere - so keep the 50 cents.

Reviews.Author: Avian N.
Reviews.Content: I really love Columbia City Bakery because, not only are their goods delicious and appealing to the all the senses, they're very involved and give back to the community. The youth nonprofit I work for (the Service Board) were in need of some food for our annual retreat, and they came to our rescue with a huge donation of sandwich rolls! We still had some left over after we came back, and because the quality of their bread is so amazing, it'll last us a couple months if frozen. Thank you Columbia City Bakery!!!

Reviews.Author: Tina H.
Reviews.Content: Mmm!  I absolutely LOVE their columbia cookies.  Something about them makes them extra special.  Is it the type of sugar?  The tiny chocolate chips?  Their pistachio pinwheels and babka are also perfectly delectable!

Reviews.Author: Kristina L.
Reviews.Content: This place was great!  We had a croissant with ham and gruyere, a chocolate pastry and a brioche.  Everything was super delicious, light, flakey and buttery.  We also had lattes.  It's a small bakery but cute.  It was pretty busy on Veterans Day morning.  Parking is a bit of a problem, but that can be expected off the main drag in Columbia City.  Other times I've been by the lines have been long and it can get sort of loud - its difficult to make yourself comfortable when there's a line of people bumping into you while you are trying to eat.

Reviews.Author: April F.
Reviews.Content: Cozy lil joint! Found this place from walking around the area. Walked in and it smelled delicious (as expected). It's a small place but it makes it cozy. I had a lemon bar and my GF had their lemon meringue pie. Both were tasty. Umk.....that is all

Reviews.Author: Laleh J.
Reviews.Content: This place is GOOD!

Reviews.Author: Sarah G.
Reviews.Content: While the coffee and cappuccino are nothing overly exciting, the atmosphere, local art, service, and baked goods are brilliant!  We picked up a very rich and moist chocolate pound cake, chocolate cake (with a touch of salt in the chocolate buttercream frosting + delicious candied lemon and cranberry on top), and their almond-rich cassata. The baked goods are aesthetically impressive and I would definitely bring these to small, intimate gatherings with friends!   Single slices were about $4 each and 3 slices easily served four people sample of each.

Reviews.Author: Lydia N.
Reviews.Content: The BEST pretzels ever! They look so adorable with their skinny tops and big fluffy bellies. The taste is perfectly balanced and definitely more than just salt and dough. Perfect treat while at the farmer's market (though the actual shop isn't too far away..)

Reviews.Author: Neal M.
Reviews.Content: I have been twice only but am wanting more.  The brioche is really great here.  I have also had desserts that were fantastic: pistachio snail, tasty croissants, etc.  Columbia City Bakery even has a very fine cup of coffee.

Reviews.Author: Sarah M.
Reviews.Content: They know how to make a good latte here and the barista is cute and friendly. I love the deserts and got some amazing passionfruit tartes here a few months back. This is a very family friendly place. I sometimes wish it was little less busy on the weekends. Be sure to check it out on the first friday of the month when Columbia City has it's BeatWalk and the stores stay open late.

Reviews.Author: april d.
Reviews.Content: Great little cafe and I would probably say its more of a cafe than a full fledged bakery.  To me a bakery is a place to get a huge selection of breads, pastries, cakes and pies and may just happen to serve coffee too, Columbia Bakery is kinda the other way around.  That said their baked goods are really delicious and their coffee really good.  Seattle has very few real bakeries (I'm used to the dedicated bakeries like San Francisco has a lot of) so my criteria and expectations are high.  All in all though, a great little spot to meet with friends or read the paper while you sip your coffee and grab a quick bite.

Reviews.Author: Lisa A.
Reviews.Content: I've only been here twice, but I love their variety.  Not only can you get the sweet stuff, but they also serve savory pastries like scones and croissants.  The ham and gruyere croissant was absolutely amazing!  The perfect amount of salty, buttery, flakey goodness in one pastry.  I've also had the chocolate cupcakes and hazelnut cupcakes.  The frostings are a perfect balance of sweetness, but not too sweet, that compliment each bite of the cake.  Yuuuummmmm...my mouth is watering just thinking about their display case.

Reviews.Author: Jillian A.
Reviews.Content: The chocolate pudding is so amazing.  Thick, rich, creamy and deeply chocolate.  The mochas are delicious and the taste of the espresso really comes through.  The blondies are such a wonderful dessert!

Reviews.Author: Cody E.
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were eating our way through Columbia City, and stumbled across this bakery.  We had already eating lunch at Empire and  went to a BBQ place (because you will not get full on Empire sandwiches).  This was our final destination for the day.  Columbia City Bakery had all the traditional fare, but seemed to add the details that make the difference.  What caught my eye this day was their selection of pretzels.  I ate a half dozen pretzels knots (little knots of pretzel dough that turn into balls of chewy goodness).

Reviews.Author: Todd D.
Reviews.Content: 5 stars for the coffee and 4 for the pastries.  5 stars for the  bearclaw.

Reviews.Author: Valisa H.
Reviews.Content: I had to review this place again since someone brought me a sandwich from here. It was absolutely incredible!! My mouth is watering just thinking about it. Now if only you dropped that ATM card fee you would get my full 5 stars. :)

Reviews.Author: Evan S.
Reviews.Content: Without question the best bakery in Seattle.

Reviews.Author: amelia A.
Reviews.Content: I love their pretzel bagels and ham n' cheese croissants. Everything else is also good.

Reviews.Author: Garth W.
Reviews.Content: Like other neighborhood folks, I ache for the C.C. Bakery to be, well, something just a bit better.  But it isn't.  I still go there, but only for specific items.Pros:  Delicious breakfast pastries (bear claw my fave, pain au chocolat, pistachio snail); truly fresh-squeezed O.J. (not "fresh" from a carton); very friendly staff; only place like it in Rainier Valley; kid-friendly.Cons:  Pricey; sloooow if you order an espresso drink; inconsistent  quality on espresso orders (I no longer get coffee there); kid-friendly (being kid-less, it feels more overrun with kids than kid-friendly to me); crowded / uncomfortable seating area.

Reviews.Author: Annie B.
Reviews.Content: I love this place and would love to give them 5 stars BUT I can't seem to leave there without spending less than 10 dollars on a breakfast.  Their torta is incredible and I offer succumb to the pastries calling my name for dessert.  Plus their fresh squeezed oj is healthy.  How can I pass that up?

Reviews.Author: James M.
Reviews.Content: Dangerously good bread. We like all the different loaves, with the multrigrain sunflower seed, pain de campagne, and the potato loaf being our go-to's. I like the potato buns (toasted) and seeded dinner rolls for my burgers. My son likes his pretzel knots. My wife is quite happy when I return with a profiterole or tres leches cake. And their baguettes are worthy of their citywide reputation.

Reviews.Author: A N.
Reviews.Content: I love the cardamom coffee cake and frangipane tart, as well as the awesome selection of coffees--all bold and delicious!  When I visit it's usually on a Sunday around breafast.  We put our name on the list at Geraldine's counter and then walk over to the Columbia City Bakery for coffee and pastries to take home for the weekend.  We never manage to walk out the door without taking a  sample of our goodies.  The Columbia City Bakery has ruined many a breakfast, because by the time our table is ready I've already had my desert and eaten it too :)  I don't live close but anytime I'm in the area I'll stop in at this delicious bakery!

Reviews.Author: Mo J.
Reviews.Content: Beautiful baked goods with simple ingredients.  Loved everything I tried here: the chewy bread rolls, cheesecake, and muffins.  The staff was very accommodating re: my questions about allergens as well.  My favorite bakery during my stay in Seattle!

Reviews.Author: Marales Q.
Reviews.Content: Lovely little lime tarts, awesome bread and a blond brownie like Grandma used to make. They also have good coffee to go with. Staff has a kind of cool vibe. I haven't yet tried the sandwiches that everyone is raving about, but now I have something to look forward to.

Reviews.Author: Alex S.
Reviews.Content: Horrible, evil bakers of my frustration!I feel like a chump paying those prices for baked goods, and then I eat those baked goods and they're unbelievably delicious and I think the prices are totally worth it -- which makes me feel like an evil Seattle gortex yuppie.Plus, everything in there will make you gain five pounds just by glancing at it.I'll probably go back tomorrow on my way to work. Did someone say bear claw?

Reviews.Author: Damon H.
Reviews.Content: My favorite bakery in the area and one of my favorites in all of Seattle - and I am an experienced and hard-core coffee and bakery person.  Nice and cozy and full of a real mix of local folks.

Reviews.Author: Liv G.
Reviews.Content: Very cute bakery with a fantastic but rather small selection of cookies, cakes, breads, etc.  You can eat in or take out and watch the work going on in the kitchen while eating in.  Coffee is good and the people working there are very friendly.

Reviews.Author: Dana M.
Reviews.Content: Yummy baked goods, so-so coffee, not so great service.

Reviews.Author: N. W.
Reviews.Content: The first, and last time I went to Columbia City Bakery, I was waiting behind four little kids who took 10 mintues to order sparkly cookies. That's not exactly what my reveiw was about, but it was still annoying. Then after waiting for 10 MINUTES, I get to the first spot in line. I had my eye on the chocolate bread and attempted to order it. However, the cashier was being incredibly rude, and kept on correcting me on how to pronounce it. The chocolate bread I ordered was good though.Four stars on food.One star on service.

Reviews.Author: Cassie S.
Reviews.Content: Uh, awesome! Stopped in on a whim and got a loaf of focaccia bread, a ham and gruyere croissant, and an orange spice cookie. The croissant was delightful...lots of cheese, crispy flaky croissant that seemed to melt on the inside. Bread made excellent sammich. And the cookie was small, but cheap, very orangey and soft. Will most definitely be back....wish they were on the Eastside.

Reviews.Author: J. Lamont C.
Reviews.Content: A bakery and a cafe! I definitely prefer this place than the Starbucks down the street. The decor is really cute, too. I ordered a brownie, and it pretty much melt in my mouth. If you love chocolate, you would love their brownie. I'm sure everything else on their menu is just as amazing!

Reviews.Author: H C.
Reviews.Content: This is a great neighborhood place to walk to. I haven't had the bread, but I trust it's great. I have had many of their desserts and they are good! I love the mini cookies they have here.

Reviews.Author: Rachel L.
Reviews.Content: If you live within a 5 mile radius, there's no excuse not to come to this bakery.  I have tried almost everything in there.  I could go on for hours, but I'll be brief.  Favorites: ham & gruyere croissant (seriously, best I have had), savory/sweet scones (perfectly sized, not too heavy, but SO flavorful), any fruit pie/cupcake/coffee cake, cassata/lemon pistachio cakes, all cookies, all the quiches/tortas, multigrain sunflower bread, hamburger/hotdog buns and the coffee (True North).  Skip (or at least on your first visit): babka (dry and lacking flavor), pistachio snail (not enough pistachio or puff pastry, oddly enough), olive bread (so hard I had difficult even eating it).Know before you go: this place can get busy, so don't go in if you are in a big hurry.

Reviews.Author: Laurie P.
Reviews.Content: My friends P., D. and I were on our annual Bakery Crawl last week surveying some newer pastry shops and revisiting a few.  Columbia City Bakery was second on our list after a trip to Belle Pastry in Bellevue.We ordered a chocolate croissant, plain croissant, almond frangipane tart with cherries, a pear danish and I bought a baguette for later.  We tend to judge bakeries by their croissants and this time P. suggested we be a little more scientific.  So we had brought an extra croissant from Belle Pastry to compare after we visited our three bakeries for the day.  (See my reviews for Belle Pastry and Bakery Nouveau).  Croissants were very good and better than Belle Pastry - more fermented flavor and great bake.   Frangipane tart was perfectly done and both P. and D. were sold on it.  I tried the baguette later than evening and was disappointed.  Although it looked beautiful and crumb structure was nice, there was no flavor.  I have had their baguettes several times before and this one was flat.  Great location for Columbia City Bakery and nice store front.  Staff was very helpful and quick.  Not sure I'd want to hang out here more than a short time as the music is always very loud - not really relaxing on a Sunday morning.  But the staff always looks like they're having fun.

Reviews.Author: Ben G.
Reviews.Content: I love this bakery! All the employees are super nice and funny. The pbj cookies are a must try and the pretzel knots with cream cheese are a perfect little snack any time of day. The baguettes are everything you can ask for - a crunchy yet thin crust and light, fluffy interior with a wonderful flavor that just leaves you wanting more. Really, everything on the menu is great... they wouldn't make it if it wasn't. This is a world-class, honest bakery with (hands down) the best pastries around!

Reviews.Author: Putty S.
Reviews.Content: Great baked goods.  Definite must tries are: sandwiches, cupcakes, pistachio snail, and carrot cake!  Iced cookies could be better.

Reviews.Author: Debra Y.
Reviews.Content: I love this place.  I am more than willing to make the drive from Renton, just to get a loaf of their amazing bread!  I haven't tried their pastries or cakes, but the lemon bars are tart, with true lemon flavor on a buttery shortbread crust.  They have a selection of colorful sugar cookies in shapes that always surprise me.  Roosters, cars, ladybugs.  They just make me smile!  This bakery is not inexpensive, but  it's well worth the price. So far, the sugar cookies have never made it back down Rainier to Renton.  A sugar cookie, a cup of their great coffee, and that drive is heaven!

Reviews.Author: Louisa D.
Reviews.Content: The pastries have already been covered as fan-fulfilling-tastic and everything I've eaten here has been exactly as I'd want it.I just want to add that in this coffee-mad town, it is rare and wonderful to come upon a bakery that also knows how to make a good cup of tea.And CCB does.It's simply bagged tea, but the water was hot enough and the tea was a delicious brand I'd never had, (Mighty Leaf), and am now buyng.

Reviews.Author: Christine O.
Reviews.Content: Great place to meet friends - if you can find room to sit and chat.  The bakery is always full and the baked goods are always wonderful.  With summer came the outdoor tables. YAY!

Reviews.Author: A C.
Reviews.Content: This is THE place to get bread. When i moved here I missed the bread from La Brea bakery in L.A. I still miss it but with Columbia City Bakery, I'm more happily resigned to go without the olive bread and sourdough batard, knowing of the amazing ficelles, seeded buns, and other delicacies that await, freshly baked at Columbia City Bakery. They have great doughnut cupcakes. The poster who said the Bear-claws and Croissants were perfect was not lying, If you've run into them and been unimpressed, prepare to be properly reacquainted here. Another really amazing creation is their upside down fruit cakes... pastry should come like this more often; a perfectly executed union of fruit with light and scrumptious cake. Another thing you should try is their savory crumpet.  I like to take those and split them in half for breakfast, then slather cream cheese and roasted jalapenos on them and eat them with a cup of homemade cafe de olla.

Reviews.Author: Jodine S.
Reviews.Content: I really want to like it here.  I do enjoy their bread, but I really believe in judging a bakery by its pastries.  I have tried at least a dozen different things, and every pastry/cake/dessert is over-buttered and too dense.  I think the prices are really high, and I don't mind paying a lot for a good bakery (i.e. Macrina), but at Columbia City Bakery, it's plain robbery.  From their chocolate pudding, to brownies, to whiskey cake, to spice cake, to their pumpkin pie, it tastes like a glob of butter mixed with whatever flavoring they are claiming to feature.  I'd love a great bakery in Columbia City, and their desserts and cakes are truly beautiful, but not worth actually putting in your mouth.

Reviews.Author: Liz O.
Reviews.Content: First of all, this place should have a 3-dollar-sign cost rating, for sure. As a person who occasionally enjoys baking at home, I appreciate the cost of quality ingredients and the labor involved. The marzipan filled bear claw pastries are consistently buttery, flaky and delicious. The seasonal apricot-almond cookies are chewy, spicy and remind me of German Lebkuchen. Well done.The tres leches cake was outstanding the first time I had it. Imagine mini pound cakes baked with butter and cream. Then after baking, the little babies are soaked in a sweet cream mixture. The result is a dreamy, creamy ,sweet uber moist confection. I eagerly anticipated my next trip to the bakery for more tres leches cake. Sadly, the second time the cake was somewhat dry and less flavorful. I ordered a caramel latte, containing house made caramel sauce. Sounded good. And it was. After my last sip, I looked into my cup and saw a yellowish, jelly like substance. Looked like a loogey. Yuk. Big turn off. So... now I go in and grab my bear claw. Then go over to Empire for coffee.

Reviews.Author: Ian D.
Reviews.Content: What a great bakery! The ham and gruyere croissant is a staple in my diet! And the service is very good as well. They've got very good baristas as well. My only complaint is there are rarely new items, which is a bad thing when I'm there several times each week! They need to put those baking skills to use and expand the menu a bit.

Reviews.Author: Edwyn A.
Reviews.Content: great neighborhood bakery and coffee shop. how can you resist the bake goods...  and with a double expresso - why not?

Reviews.Author: Abby W.
Reviews.Content: Excellent! Great selection, best sourdough I've ever had... Which is a lot.

Reviews.Author: La L.
Reviews.Content: i have issues with the over-bakedvery very brown pistachio snails and bear claws.  but love their walnut levain!service is awesome too!

Reviews.Author: kate o.
Reviews.Content: I used to love this place,  was their customer since their shop opened. However, since they became popular, their services became less friendly and courtesy. My little son love cheesecake here and they seemed to make it less often, which he could accept  that and just chose something else. Sadly, we went at 5.05pm. today and they closed at 5.00pm, so I asked if we could just do take out bakery in the showcase for my son. Answer was no!  We were closed!  I felt bad as a mother, who drove my little son there just to disappoint him. I wondered how much worked they had to do just to make their customers happy and return. Maybe they didn't care to lose some at this point.

Reviews.Author: Alicia N.
Reviews.Content: This place is AMAZING!! i love their Focattia bread and multigrain sunflower...both are to die for!! the pastries are delicious. i recently had one of their brownies and it was like chocolate butter. Best brownie i ever ate. i also enjoy their other baked good like the blondie and bear claw. i wish they had a bigger place though. during rush hour it gets really hot and claustrphobic. if you haven't been i highly recommend to stop by and grab something to go.

Reviews.Author: Leah S.
Reviews.Content: Big fan.

Reviews.Author: Arthur M.
Reviews.Content: This is, hands down, the best danish I have ever had.  Ever.  I'm sure everything else is good, but the danish is just so good that I can't bear to go there and not get the danish.  MMMMMmmmm.

Reviews.Author: Giovanna L.
Reviews.Content: The product is fantastic, but the service has been so unpleasant on several occasions, that I have stopped going in. Most recently, five of us went in for pastries and coffee, my guests all excited about the pastries and bread I had touted. After an unbelievable display of rudeness by the two girls/young women behind the counter (in response to our question, one turned to the other who literally crossed her arms over her chest and rolled her eyes while mouthing "no" in clear view of us all). We looked at one another in disbelief, turned and walked out (and drove to Both Ways for fantastic food and friendly staff). I mentioned this experience to a friend at the Columbia City farmers' market this week, (as I was buying CCB bread from the very nice and competent employee there) and she matched that and raised me one. Two other bystanders piped up with similar tales. Owners, are you listening? We love our neighborhood bakery, but we cannot tolerate that kind of behavior while spending our hard earned $!!
